articles.title: Drones get new ultrasonic vision upgrade, thanks to bat-inspired AI

articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Michigan have developed an AI-powered echolocation system that allows robots and drones to navigate in total darkness. articles.title: Meta names ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist of Superintelligence Lab

The company invested $14.3 billion in data labeling startup Scale AI last month.

articles.title: Why Some Investors Are Betting Big on Quantum Computing as a Moonshot Artificial Intelligence (AI) Play
articles.author: Adam Spatacco
articles.summary: Quantum technology is forecast to become a $200 billion market over the coming decades. One of the hottest stocks in the quantum movement is a company called Quantum Computing, which has seen its stock soar by nearly 3,000% in the last year. The company was once doing business as Innovative Beverage Group Holdings (IBGH). After an unsuccessful venture in the beverage market, it was later followed by lawsuits from investors and rebranded as Quantum Computing.

articles.title: County hires company to create an AI policy
articles.summary: Douglas County commissioners approved a $50,000 contract with A.J. Rehm and Associates to create a policy for AI use by county staff. The company will also provide training for the county's IT team and conduct an audit of how the policy is working.

articles.title: AI's Growing Reach: Insurance Sector Beyond Underwriting Transformation
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming the insurance industry beyond underwriting and risk profiling. Claims management and customer service have emerged as key beneficiaries of AI. Customer service has witnessed a substantial boost in AI integration. AI's role in product development has more than tripled. Insurance fraud costs the industry billions annually.

articles.title: Headline: 'How the Trump AI Action Plan will Wreck Green Energy', By Eric Worrall
articles.author: Eric Worrall
articles.summary: The White House today released 'Winning the AI Race: America's AI Action Plan'. It is in accordance with President Trump's January executive order on Removing Barriers to American Leadership in AI. The Plan identifies over 90 Federal policy actions across three pillars – Accelerating Innovation, Building American AI Infrastructure, and Leading in International Diplomacy and Security.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg names ex-OpenAI employee chief scientist of new Meta AI lab
articles.author: Ashley Capoot

In June, Zuckerberg announced a new organization called Meta Superintelligence Labs made up of top AI researchers and engineers. Shengjia Zhao, the co-creator of OpenAI's ChatGPT, will serve as the chief scientist of the lab.

It uses data from Outlook calendar, emails, Microsoft 365 apps (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), browsing history, and location data. It analyzes how you work and predicts what you might want to do.

articles.title: Digital delusions: The rising phenomenon of AI-induced psychological distress
articles.author: Séamus Bellamy
articles.summary: There is a support group for people suffering from AI psychosis. AI psychosis comes from spending too much time with an anthropomorphic AI chatbot. Chatbots like ChatGPT tend to mirror the needs and beliefs of their users, so it's easy to get sucked into the narratives and statements put forward by the AI.

articles.title: Google's Opal: Test Vibe-Coding App

The tool is currently available for testing through Google Labs in the U.S. Google's move with Opal suggests a strategic intent to capture a wider market. It's a significant step towards making AI-driven development truly accessible and adaptable.

articles.title: CoSyn: The open-source tool that's making GPT-4V-level vision AI accessible to everyone
articles.summary: Yue Yang, a recent Penn Engineering Ph.D. graduate and co-first author of the research, has developed a tool called CoSyn that uses synthetic data to train an AI system on text-rich images. The breakthrough comes as enterprises increasingly seek AI systems capable of understanding and reasoning about complex visual information. The technology is already finding real-world applications across industries.

Yahoo led with 2.3 million AI referrals in June 2025, followed by Yahoo Japan, Reuters, The Guardian, India Times, Business Insider and YouTube. Google was at the top of the list with 53.1 million referrals to tech and social sites.

It compiles the visit into a note that providers can review and edit afterward.

Electricity demand from data centers worldwide is set to more than double by 2030, to slightly more than the entire electricity consumption of Japan today. articles.title: Trump wants to ban 'woke AI.' Here's why it's hard to make a truly neutral chatbot.

articles.title: Trump wants to ban 'woke AI.' Here's why it's hard to make a truly neutral chatbot.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence: ‘Humanity is slowly slipping away from us'
